channel.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
channel.description:
Okay im a begginer scripter.. i writen a few non runescape scripts but im trying to make a really simple ess miner.
Is it possible to make the screen rotate until it finds a bitmap/DTM? If so how..
Whats the function for right clicking?
How would i be able to make it wait until the last inventory slot is full?
Please help!!! It'll help me learn.

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Im sucha stupid fucking dickhead… you log in at the angle i fuckin wanted!!

Oh well ty for the help and i learnt alot… incase you were wondering, with a few touch ups, i got it to work

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

goatee:

Ummm theres no repeat in that so why would you need an until?

Whoops, didn’t finish it.
[scar]
Function rotate: Boolean;
var Bitmap: Integer;
begin
Bitmap := BitmapFromString(12, 10, ‘0000000000000000000000’ +
‘00CB771F1D47735394C4679DBD6285974E656C000000000000E9A’ +
‘B3FE7B040E3922AE68D26A855182341605292BA7DB9D66495B626’ +
‘5681486471000000E59930E59F35E6912AE68F2DE98B3CA56F373’ +
‘F799F58A6D158A7D42E7FB51A507E000000E5932DE69129E58A25’ +
‘E47D1DCA81’); //The minimap compass (the bitmap isnt really that its part of the firefox icon :P).

if FindBitmap(Bitmap,x,y) then begin Result:=True; Exit; end;
SendArrowSilentWait(1,100+random(300));
end;

begin
repeat
wait(50);
FindRandoms;
until Rotate;
end.[/scar]

There, experiment with that.

Read full topic

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

goatee:

Yeh i know… just wondering if it would work lol… anyways for the rotated could i just tell it to hold down the right arrows key until it finds the bitmap?

You could rotate it in sections. Kinda like this:

[scar]procedure rotate;
var Bitmap: Integer;
begin
Bitmap := BitmapFromString(12, 10, ‘0000000000000000000000’ +
‘00CB771F1D47735394C4679DBD6285974E656C000000000000E9A’ +
‘B3FE7B040E3922AE68D26A855182341605292BA7DB9D66495B626’ +
‘5681486471000000E59930E59F35E6912AE68F2DE98B3CA56F373’ +
‘F799F58A6D158A7D42E7FB51A507E000000E5932DE69129E58A25’ +
‘E47D1DCA81’); //The minimap compass (the bitmap isnt really that its part of the firefox icon :P).

if FindBitmap(Bitmap,x,y) then Exit;
SendArrowSilentWait(1,100+random(300));
Until(findbitmap(Bitmap, x, y));
end;
End;[/scar]

Try that!

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Yeh i know… just wondering if it would work lol… anyways for the rotated could i just tell it to hold down the right arrows key until it finds the bitmap? If i could can someone point me in the right direction of how to do that? And would it be somthing like this?:

procedure rotate;
begin

      Bitmap := BitmapFromString(12, 10, '0000000000000000000000' +
       '00CB771F1D47735394C4679DBD6285974E656C000000000000E9A' +
       'B3FE7B040E3922AE68D26A855182341605292BA7DB9D66495B626' +
       '5681486471000000E59930E59F35E6912AE68F2DE98B3CA56F373' +
       'F799F58A6D158A7D42E7FB51A507E000000E5932DE69129E58A25' +
       'E47D1DCA81'); //The minimap compass (the bitmap isnt really that its part of the firefox icon :P).

Keydown(Rightarrow:Byte); //Whats the number for right arrows and WTF is a byte.
Until(findbitmap(Bitmap, x, y))
End;

Would that work and whats a byte?

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

[scar]program New;
procedure mine; forward;

procedure mine;
begin
blah blah blah // clicking the rune essence.
end;

procedure inv;
begin
repeat
mine;
until (invfull)
if (invfull) then
end;

begin
inv
end.[/scar]
thats for using another procedure in another one that isnt in the main begin and end.

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:4, topic:11131”]Wow thanks alot guys! This has really helped me! :D!!

EDIT: okay the rotate one doesnt seem to work so i changed it a tiny bit but now it has identifier expected where it says until… Umm help?

[scar]program MrEssMiner;
{.include SRLSRL.scar}

Procedure RotateTheBitmapUntilFound(Increase: Extended);
var Bitmap, Finish: Integer;
Angle: Extended;
begin
Bitmap := BitmapFromString(20, 22, ‘z78DA9595517283300C44AF6’ +
‘40C38C92764E8FD8F54CAD299A50FA90E1F8A47B6F5BCB2A5D452’ +
‘CBB0CDE3B44CA595FD7796AD5B7DD6E1B4C71AB76D2AFB97DBE31’ +
‘B347EBCCAF6674DC402D1778D5FF72CC69747EB65E591D21E75CE’ +
‘7ACEC37AB5517CCDBA5F9E8BD2349364BD5AADBF96F19DEE1EADA’ +
‘7D25C9DB3683FE69A52CDFAABF887F81EDB1D97C40B37CDADD36F’ +
‘586EC18D32E0DCE81E9D7EAA067159A75686887BE33F76796EF33’ +
‘713114FEEE1F1F83E4B2E95863708162DE3E72BC3179B6ACCAD6E’ +
‘47BBD6656F4D93DB5CA9679859D5983135EBDCF7A3ED4543EE4FF’ +
‘42B5D63F9C9F51BF4688AEF5CAD91DFE93D5C8D5DA9FCCEF5C89E’ +
‘67726555DD8AE314F7B86AF7443179BFBC23D79B73E9CF6B4ADC1’ +
‘EEB67F03C30E73EEE89CCB3F1BFB24729F5E6AA7923EC8DFDDCE8’ +
‘5DF5BC2EF62B6658278F2A8B7514BD2ED651A49A9D993D907D835’ +
‘5CCAE15F5E74B07EBE89651D78A767D034D661FDD’);
Angle:=0;
while (Angle < 360) do
begin
RotateBitmap(bitmap, 5); //Rotates the Bitmap about 5 degrees each time.
until(findBitmap(bitmap, x, y)) then
begin
Finish:=Round(Angle);
writeln('Found it '+IntToStr(Finish));
break;
end; //Breaks out of the loop.
Angle:=Angle+Increase;
end;
end;

begin
Activateclient;
wait(3000)
RotateTheBitmapUntilFound(2.5);
end.[/scar][br][size=1]Posted at: August 27, 2006, 06:04:18 AM[/size][hr]Oh fiddle sticks and hay … lol

Is it possible to have a procedure inside a procedure?

Like for when its mining you have this:


procedure mine;
begin
blah blah blah // clicking the rune essence.
end;

procedure inv;
begin
repeat
mine;
until (invfull)
if (invfull) then
end;

I dunno if it will or not :S[/quote]

I think it may not work because you do not use actual 360 degree circle. But I’m not sure, you would have to ask someone else. The reason you are getting Identifier expected is because you have an until statement, but no Repeat statement. While … do is a type of a repeat loop. However, you do not use until to get out of it.

What you are trying to do in the current script, will do the same thing as the first script. So, I am thinking it is something to do with the angles…

Also, it is possible to use Procedures inside Procedures. Think about how SCAR was made. Let’s use RotateBitmap as an example. RotateBitmap is also a Procedure, the only diffference is that it was injected into the Source code of SCAR. You can use Procedures inside Procedures all you want. Same with Functions (Functions return something, such as True, or False.)

Hope I could help.

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Wow thanks alot guys! This has really helped me! :D!!

EDIT: okay the rotate one doesnt seem to work so i changed it a tiny bit but now it has identifier expected where it says until… Umm help?

[scar]program MrEssMiner;
{.include SRLSRL.scar}

Procedure RotateTheBitmapUntilFound(Increase: Extended);
var Bitmap, Finish: Integer;
Angle: Extended;
begin
Bitmap := BitmapFromString(20, 22, ‘z78DA9595517283300C44AF6’ +
‘40C38C92764E8FD8F54CAD299A50FA90E1F8A47B6F5BCB2A5D452’ +
‘CBB0CDE3B44CA595FD7796AD5B7DD6E1B4C71AB76D2AFB97DBE31’ +
‘B347EBCCAF6674DC402D1778D5FF72CC69747EB65E591D21E75CE’ +
‘7ACEC37AB5517CCDBA5F9E8BD2349364BD5AADBF96F19DEE1EADA’ +
‘7D25C9DB3683FE69A52CDFAABF887F81EDB1D97C40B37CDADD36F’ +
‘586EC18D32E0DCE81E9D7EAA067159A75686887BE33F76796EF33’ +
‘713114FEEE1F1F83E4B2E95863708162DE3E72BC3179B6ACCAD6E’ +
‘47BBD6656F4D93DB5CA9679859D5983135EBDCF7A3ED4543EE4FF’ +
‘42B5D63F9C9F51BF4688AEF5CAD91DFE93D5C8D5DA9FCCEF5C89E’ +
‘67726555DD8AE314F7B86AF7443179BFBC23D79B73E9CF6B4ADC1’ +
‘EEB67F03C30E73EEE89CCB3F1BFB24729F5E6AA7923EC8DFDDCE8’ +
‘5DF5BC2EF62B6658278F2A8B7514BD2ED651A49A9D993D907D835’ +
‘5CCAE15F5E74B07EBE89651D78A767D034D661FDD’);
Angle:=0;
while (Angle < 360) do
begin
RotateBitmap(bitmap, 5); //Rotates the Bitmap about 5 degrees each time.
until(findBitmap(bitmap, x, y)) then
begin
Finish:=Round(Angle);
writeln('Found it '+IntToStr(Finish));
break;
end; //Breaks out of the loop.
Angle:=Angle+Increase;
end;
end;

begin
Activateclient;
wait(3000)
RotateTheBitmapUntilFound(2.5);
end.[/scar][br][size=1]Posted at: August 27, 2006, 06:04:18 AM[/size][hr]Oh fiddle sticks and hay … lol

Is it possible to have a procedure inside a procedure?

Like for when its mining you have this:


procedure mine;
begin
blah blah blah // clicking the rune essence.
end;

procedure inv;
begin
repeat
mine;
until (invfull)
if (invfull) then
end;

I dunno if it will or not :S

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

item.title: DTM help, right clicking and rotating
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

goatee:

Okay im a begginer scripter… i writen a few non runescape scripts but im trying to make a really simple ess miner.

I suggest using SRL, to make your scripting better… www.villu-reborn.com


Is it possible to make the screen rotate until it finds a bitmap/DTM? If so how…
It would be easier, and less detectable if you used something like RotateBitmap(bitmap: Integer; angle: Extended):Integer;
then put it in a repeat loop, with an increasing angle for each loop. Then have it search for the Bitmap, like this:
[scar]program New;
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}
Procedure RotateTheBitmapUntilFound(Increase: Extended);
var Bitmap, Finish: Integer;
Angle: Extended;
begin
Bitmap := BitmapFromString(19, 10, ‘z78DA737343000324E046474’ +
‘04F1B91EDC2652F6638101332B8D4106323F126106F0EA92A29B7’ +
‘91F850A2C446DA89E312C19F1E28111FD87C47FF3C0E0100D4D21’ +
‘E84’);
Angle:=0;
while (Angle < 360) do
begin
RotateBitmap(Bitmap, Angle); //Rotates the Bitmap about 5 degrees each time.
if FindBitmap(Bitmap,x,y) then
begin
Finish:=Round(Angle);
writeln('Found it '+IntToStr(Finish));
break;
end; //Breaks out of the loop.
Angle:=Angle+Increase;
end;
end;

begin
RotateTheBitmapUntilFound(2.5);
end.[/scar]
P.S. I am not to familiar with Rotated Bitmaps, so that may be incorrect on the Angle.

In order to Find a Rotated DTM, all you have to do is use the function FindDTMRotated(DTM:LongInt;var x,y:LongInt;x1,y1,x2,y2:LongInt; StartAngle, EndAngle, AngleStep:Extended;var Angle:Extended):Boolean;

Whats the function for right clicking?
In SRL, just use Mouse(x,y,randx,randY,false); X, and y are the coordinates. Randx, and Randy, are the random clicking added to the coordinates. False, makes a right click.

How would i be able to make it wait until the last inventory slot is full?

In SRL, do something like this:
[scar]repeat
FindNormalRandoms;
wait(10);
until(InvFull);[/scar]

I hope I could help, if you have any more questions, just ask.

Read full topic
item.source: DTM help, right clicking and rotating

hopefully this helps.
